descriptive_name: 2-[2-(2-butoxyethoxy)ethoxy]ethanol; TEGBE; triethylene glycol monobutyl ether; butoxytriethylene glycol

acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Based on its 72-hour EC50 of > 920mg/L for algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata), 48-hour EC50 for crustaceans (Daphnia magna), and 96-hour LC50 of > 100mg/L for fish (medaka) (Test for the Ecological Effect of Chemical Substances (Ministry of the Environment), 1998), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since the rabbit LD50 = 3540mg/kg (SIDS (accessed July 2008)), the substance was classified into "Not classified" using JIS classification criteria (Category 5 in the United Nations classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on its rat LCLo > 200mg/L/1H, which is equivalent to 50mg/L/4H (SIDS (accessed July 2008)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 obtained from List 1 source (5300mg/kg, 6660mg/kg, and 5170mg/kg) (accessed July 2008), DFGOT (vol.9 2007)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it is water soluble (water solubility: 1,000,000mg/L (SRC, 2005)) and its classification for acute toxicity is "Not classified", the substance was classified into "Not classified".

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Its flash point is 143degC (Sax (11th, 2008)), which is higher than 93degC.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Negative results were obtained from in vitro mutagenicity tests (Ames tests) (SIDS (accessed July 2008), DFGOT vol.9)), but since there was no in vivo test data available, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its autoignition point is 203degC (SIDS (2002)), which is higher than 70degC.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In oral route exposure tests using rats during the organogenetic period, no effects were detected on the development of offspring (SIDS (accessed July 2008)). However, the tests did not provide any data on the reproductive functions and fertility of parental animals. As such, classification is not possible.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: After applications of the substance into the eyes of rabbits, redness and swelling of the conjunctivas were observed at every observation time and in all treated animals, and the total testing score was 21 (out of 110 maximum) (SIDS (accessed July 2008)). In addition, a different test, in which various concentrations of the substance were applied, resulted in that the substance was highly irritating and was scored 5 (out of 10 maximum) (SIDS (accessed July 2008)). Based on these results, the substance was classified into Category 2A.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In several 24-hour skin irritation tests using rabbits, various conclusions were drawn: the substance was not, slightly, or moderately irritating (SIDS (accessed in July 2008)). In some of the tests that concluded that the substance was moderately irritating, congestion of blood in the capillary was noted, but the irritation score was only Grade 3 (Given that grades were calculated with10 as the maximum rating, not 8, Grade 3 generally represents a severe case of capillary congestion), which suggested no development of erythema or edema. In addition, 24-hour administration may have contributed to stronger reactions than shorter-term tests. Overall, taking negative results into account, the substance was classified into "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: A 21-day dermal administration test using rabbits is the only repeated exposure test documented on this substance; no toxic effects were found (SIDS (accessed July 2008)). However, this test alone with only one dose administered (1000mg/kg/day) does not provide sufficient information for the evaluation of systemic toxicity. Thus, classification is not possible.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In the oral route, dermal route, and inhalation (mist) tests conducted, no effects were observed at administration doses (3200mg/kg for oral, 2000mg/kg for dermal, and 200mg/L for inhalation) that were higher than the upper limit of Category 2 guidance values (SIDS (accessed July 2008)). Therefore, the substance was classified into "Not classified" (oral, dermal, inhalation).
